attributes.comment:
USCIS fees necessary to facilitate international adoption should be excluded from
the fee increase outlined in this proposed rule. The Federal Government has
emphatically expressed support for international adoption in recent years by
providing a substantial tax benefit to alleviate the financial burden of adoption in
general. An increase in USCIS fees related to the international adoption process
would only work against the forward progress of making international adoption a
viable option to many prospective adoptive families. In essence, an increase in
fees related to international adoption would work directly against the adoption tax
benefit afforded to us by the Federal Government. The fee revenue with respect to
international adoption is a small percentage of the total revenue generated from
immigration related fees. Tax paying Americans who choose to pursue
international adoption should not be required to pay excessive fees for a service
that should be supportive to their efforts instead of restrictive. Again, I respectfully
propose that USCIS fees related to international adoption be excluded from the fee
increase that is prescribed in the proposed rule.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Charles W. Gray
